result.execSummary:
The defendant Miguel A Torrella was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-THC (<=200 grams), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)1.
  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).
  • Possession of Cocaine/Coca, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Court advises the Defendant that under Wisconsin Statute 302.113 the amount actually served may be extended, and that the Defendant could serve the entire bifurcated sentence in prison. The Defendant will be subject to certain conditions while on release to extended supervision, and a violation of any of those conditions may result in the Defendant being returned to prison. 

Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 45 days time served.

miscConds.notes: Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge, during the course of probation to the probation agent. Any remaining balance due at the end of probation will become immediately due or civil judgment to be entered.
Seek/Maintain Full Time employment as able.

No possession of any firearms or weapons, firearm ammunition, firearm holster, firearm magazine, or any body armor.
AS TO COUNT 1 AND 2:
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.

No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.
No possession of any drug paraphernalia for personal use, manufacturing, delivering or for distribution.
Defendant to not associate with any known gang member, associate or affiliate.

Provide DNA sample, if not already done. 
Mental Health Evaluation and any recommended treatment. Court recommends Trauma Informed Mental Health Treatment.

Maintain Absolute Sobriety, no alcohol.
Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including drug and alcohol testing.

supervisions.notes:
AS TO COUNTS 2 & 3: Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge, by May 1, 2016; failure to pay will result in an entry of civil judgment. 
Provide DNA sample, if not already done.

Concurrent with: Concurrent with Count 3 and consecutive to any other sentence; release for  inmate work assignments and The Day Reporting Center; credit for 0 days time served.  Court notes a strong objection to electronic monitoring.

AS TO COUNT 1 AND 2:
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.

Concurrent with: Concurrent with Count 2 and consecutive to any other sentence; release for inmate work assignments and The Day Reporting Center; credit for 0 days time served.  Court notes a strong objection to electronic monitoring.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Miguel A Torrella

records.addlTxt: Order denying request for electronic monitoring, signed and filed.
Per Order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to Carolina Stark, Branch 17, for review. jbs
Defendant's pro se request for release on electronic monitoring.

Defendant Miguel A Torrella in court with attorney Calvin R. Malone.  Defendant Miguel A Torrella in custody.  Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.  

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

AS TO COUNT 1:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 2 YEARS, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 45 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 1 YEAR; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 1 YEAR.  

Defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Substance Abuse Program. 

Court STAYED the sentence and placed defendant on probation for 2 YEARS with the following conditions:

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
- Maintain Absolute Sobriety, no alcohol.
- No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid 
  prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.
- Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment
  and successfully complete recommended treatment
  including drug and alcohol testing.
- No possession of any drug paraphernalia for personal use, manufacturing, delivering or for distribution.
- No possession of any firearms or weapons, firearm ammunition, firearm holster, firearm magazine, or any body armor.
- Seek/Maintain Full Time employment as able. 
- Defendant to not associate with any known gang member, associate or affiliate. 
- Mental Health Evaluation and any recommended treatment. Court recommends Trauma Informed Mental Health Treatment. 
- Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge, during the course of probation to the probation agent. Any remaining balance due at the end of probation will become immediately due or civil judgment to be entered.
- Provide DNA sample, if not already done. 

AS TO COUNT 2:
Court ordered defendant to serve 12 MONTHS in the House of Correction concurrent with Count 3 and consecutive to any other sentence; release for  inmate work assignments and The Day Reporting Center; credit for 0 days time served.  Court notes a strong objection to electronic monitoring. 
- Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge, by May 1, 2016; failure to pay will result in an entry of civil judgment. 
- Provide DNA sample, if not already done. 

AS TO COUNT 3:
Court ordered defendant to serve 3 MONTHS in the House of Correction concurrent with Count 2 and consecutive to any other sentence; release for inmate work assignments and The Day Reporting Center; credit for 0 days time served.  Court notes a strong objection to electronic monitoring
- Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge, by May 1, 2016; failure to pay will result in an entry of civil judgment.

AS TO COUNT 1:
Court advises the Defendant that under Wisconsin Statute 302.113 the amount actually served may be extended, and that the Defendant could serve the entire bifurcated sentence in prison. The Defendant will be subject to certain conditions while on release to extended supervision, and a violation of any of those conditions may result in the Defendant being returned to prison. 

AS TO COUNT 1 AND 2:
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting. 

Appellate rights notice given to the defendant. 

Filed;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit.
Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department pending Sentencing.

Defendant Miguel A Torrella in court with attorney Calvin R. Malone.  Brandon Wigley for Danielle E. Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defendant Miguel A Torrella in court with attorney Calvin R. Malone.  Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
AS TO COUNT  1, 2, and 3  - 
The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Jury Instructions and Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.
Court orders case adjourned for Sentencing on 10-15-2014 at 8:30 a.m., Br. 17.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 15, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Note:  Court REITERATES that the defendant MAINTAIN Absolute Sobriety and NOT possess or use any controlled substances unless by valid prescription.  
Plea hearing scheduled for September 11, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Miguel A Torrella in court with attorney Calvin R Malone.  Kevin Shomin appeared for Nathaniel Adamson for the State of Wisconsin.
Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Konkol.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Pocan, Branch 26.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY  to be monitored by drug testing.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription, no drug paraphernalia and no alcohol.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Miguel A Torrella in court with attorney Calvin R Malone.  Defendant Miguel A Torrella in custody.  Kevin Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Konkol, Branch 44. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Defense entered a plea of NOT GUILTY as to Count 3.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 3, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
